Chicago R Users Group

Open source community engaging in an extendable language

Home Mission Resources Sponsors About Us Find Us

A mainstay of the R language is the emphasis of open in open-source. As such, R is an emerging tool among private, public, and non-profit ventures. See below for a few of its many outlets.

Organizations

CRAN - a network of ftp and web servers around the world that store identical, up-to-date, versions of code and documentation for R

RStudio - active member of the R community who maintains the popular IDE, cloud solution for Shiny apps, and contributes to many R packages

R Consortium - group organized to support the worldwide community of users, maintainers and developers of R software

DataCamp - learning service that offers interactive R, Python, Sheets, SQL and shell courses

rOpenSci - non-profit initiative founded in 2011 to make scientific data retrieval reproducible

Platforms

Microsoft R Open - the enhanced distribution of R from Microsoft Corporation

IBM Analyzing with R - instructions and how-to for using R with the Db2Â® database.

Oracle R Enterprise - a component that makes R ready for the enterprise and big data

AWS Running R - instructions and best practices for running R on AWS

Google Open Source - work to support the sustainability of open source organizations and communities

Tutorials / Docs

R-Bloggers - a blog aggregator of content contributed by bloggers who write about R

Revolutions - blog dedicated to news and information of interest to members of the R community

RDocumentation - search portal of all 15,000+ CRAN, Bioconductor and GitHub packages

RForge - strives to provide a collaborative environment for R package developers

rddr.io - comprehensive index of R packages and documentation from CRAN, Bioconductor, GitHub and R-Forge

Tidyverse - opinionated collection of R packages designed for data science

Community

Meetup R User Group - worldwide network of R User Groups that have been sponsored by the R Consortium

Data Science with R Facebook Group - a bunch of data science enthusiasts who like R language

StackOverflow R Tag - tag used for the 250,000+ programming-related questions about R

GitHub R Trending - currently trending R repositories

Reddit r/RLanguage - subscibers interested in implementing R programming language for statistics and data science

APIs

Python rpy2 - Python interface of R as a lower-level language

Rcpp - R package providing seamless R and C++ Integration

RJava - R package allowing the use of Java from R as well as embedding R into Java

SAS R Interface - component of IML providing the capability to interface with the R language

Mathematica R Interface - integration of R code into Mathematica workflow
